characters: THE IMAGES START TO MOVE FASTER
-- CARL AT SOUTHWEST BANK TALKING TO NORMAN.
FLASH OF SANJI LOOMING LARGE IN CARL'S EYES.
CUT TO A TEN YEAR OLD GIRL SITTING WITH HER SILENT MOM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's New Year's Eve at Rudy's, a hole-in-the-wall dive. People stream into the bar to celebrate. Outside, CARL KENDALL (30s) and his soon-to-be ex-girlfriend KATH are having a quiet intense discussion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't do anything more. You used to be fun. Now you hardly ever even leave your apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here, aren't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's because it's New Year's Eve. You have to be here. Besides, it's not only social stuff. You used to have dreams. You wanted to go to business school, you wanted to work for the World Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I discovered b-school's not for me. People grow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Growing is "X is not for me so I'll do Y." You went X is not for me and so I guess I'll sit on the couch for the rest of my life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ACQUIESCING) Well, look, this sucks, but I understand where you're coming from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the problem. You don't even care that I'm breaking up with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I care.   But I also understand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't just understand. You should be mad. Or upset. Or sad. Or something.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're at different places in our lives. I get it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your girlfriend of two years breaks up with you right before New Year's Eve and all you can say is "I get it?" It is completely within your right to call me a bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be inappropriate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (tearing up) I can't believe I've been dating someone so emotionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mere.   It'll be OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hugs her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rudy's is a dive bar. Dartboard, pool table, scuffed wood floors, Miller Lite sign, etc. The patrons are all FACING THE GIANT TELEVISION. The New Year's Ball is DROPPING. Among the patrons is our hero Carl, his best friend PETER Peter's girlfriend LUCY, their party friend ROONEY and hi girlfriend, Kath who's still a little red-eyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three, two, one... happy New Year!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone BLOWS NOISEMAKERS and POPS CHAMPAGNE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PATRONS (cont'd) (SINGING) Should auld acquaintance be forgot and never brought to mind? Should auld acquaintance be forgot and days of auld lang syne?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that was fantastic.   Good night, guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going, already?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We haven't even finished the song yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the ball drop and hugged all of you. Aliens didn't invade. Our computers are still working. What else could possibly happen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney might throw up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's true.     I'm very close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see that happen like every night. Good night and Happy New Year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl leaves.   His friends look concerned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did he take the break-up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CRYING) Like a robot. Two years, and nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm so sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl goes into his apartment. He lies down in his bed and closes his eyes. CLOSE ON THE ALARM. His alarm goes off. Carl HITS IT off. It's now DAYTIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gets dressed.   He puts on a nametag for Southwest B

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks down the street, fast. He passes a CUTE GIRL who's name we'll learn is RENEE passing out flyers for a called "The Flying Buttresses."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wanna rock out tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't rock out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He walks into Dunkin Donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dunkin Donuts Cashier hands Carl his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like an Italian-inspired coffee flavoring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about the double doughnut special?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits at his cubicle, flips on his email.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the email) Dear Trusted Foreigner, Allow me to introduce myself. I am the deposed King of Nigeria and I wish to propose a confidential transaction. (to the computer) Allow me to delete you, my liege.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMAN, his needy boss, comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My teller reporting for duty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a soldier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a soldier on the front line of finance. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMAN (cont'd) So, Carl, I'm having a party this Friday. It's a funny hat party. May I entreat you to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at his calendar.   It's totally empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly lying) I'm out of town.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stands in the middle of the floor staring into the middle distance. A CUSTOMER approaches him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, I need to speak to a loan specialist and there's no one on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry. Today I'm officially a greeter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But there's no one around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someone might come. And if I'm not here, they won't be greeted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really not going to help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Until I'm relieved as a greeter, my hands are tied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bank Customer sits down in the sectioned off waiting as Carl stands in the middle of the floor. It is very awkward. No one comes in. Carl slowly moves so a column blocks the customer's view of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now that Carl's behind the column, he has a clear view of entrance of the bank. Through the floor to ceiling window he sees the handsome NEW PRESIDENT OF SOUTHWEST BANK, CHR PARKER, tear up in a Mercedes. He steps out of the Merced with a hot girl on his arm. He and the girl walk into the bank. Carl stares at them, jealously.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, there. I'm Chris Parker. The new president of Southwest Bank. Just wanted to come by and personally introduce myself to every branch manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That would be me.   Norman Calhoun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris turns to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Carl Kendall.   Just a teller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was "just a teller." And now I'm "just president of the largest bank in the Southwest." (to Norman) You need anything, you let corporate know. You hear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris Parker and his HOT SECRETARY leaves.     Carl watch them, clearly jealous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMAN (cont'd) Nice work if you can get it.   Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly jealous) Yeah, if you're into fake breasts and German engineering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Check and check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bank Customer comes around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help me now?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but this gentleman can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl indicates Norman.   Norman goes to help the customer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stares up at the clock.   The clock finally CLICKS T 5:00PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think about my party, Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl microwaves a Lean Cuisine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl watches Survivor while eating Lean Cuisine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl lays down and closes his eyes. The alarm GOES OFF again. PULL BACK to reveal it's morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into Dunkin Donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like an Italian --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl ignores the girl handing out fliers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Valentine party. Just wear something red!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stares as the clock clicks to 5:00.        He's out

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl warms up a frozen pizza.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl eats the frozen pizza and watches Big Brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl lies down.       The alarm FLIPS ON.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- ON THE STREET. Carl refuses the pamphlet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dress as your favorite animal --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl eats frozen lasagna while watching The Amazing Race.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- historical figure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CARL AT HOME EATING FROZEN MEATLOAF AND WATCHING Proje Runway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's now just a blur of images of Carl at Southwest Bank, shaking his head `no', eating Lean Cuisine and watching reality television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's lying on his bed.      The phone is ringing.   He and answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Carl. It's Peter. Where are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in bed. Why?       What happened? Did someone die?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) No. It's just -- we're at Rudy's. Celebrating New Year's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at the alarm.     It's 11:15 PM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's already 11:15.     I don't think I can make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, c'mon, Carl. No one's seen you for like forever. Please swing by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Tell everyone Happy New Year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl lies down and hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl watches his alarm clock FLIP TO 12:00AM.     He clos eyes and goes to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's eating lunch at a picnic table outside. Several ba employees smoke cigarettes near him. An oddly hyper guy named ALEX approaches Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Kendall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex Eberts? What's up, buddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex hugs Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too much! How've you been? I can't believe you're still working here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where've you been? Norman's been heartbroken since you quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where've I been? You mean, where haven't I been? This year. Dude. I have lived. I climbed Mt. Kilmanjaro. I ate bat in Laos. I shot a cow with a bazooka. I'm not proud of that last one but I did it. How's the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Same old same old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? That's the problem. That's everyone's problem. You've got one life. Why waste it on the same old same old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex hands Carl a pamphlet for a "Just Say Yes" seminar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ALEX (cont'd) I know this will sound queer, but you have to hit this seminar. It changed my life. It will change yours. Unless you like the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding? Every day it's impossible not to throw rocks at the place. (JOKING) Since you don't work here anymore, you want to throw a couple?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex starts WHIPPING rocks at the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing!   Stop that!   I was kidding!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman comes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you think you're doing? (recognizing Alex) Alex Eberts! Is this an alumnae prank? I love pranks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Norman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alex continues throwing rocks at the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into a walkie-talkie) We have a situation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple portly security guards come out and wrestle Alex the ground. He manages to escape and run from the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go to the seminar, Carl!    You won't be sorry!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into his apartment.    He hits PLAY on his ans machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the answering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, it's Peter. I know you don't do things anymore, but it'd mean a lot if you'd come by Rudy's tonight. Lucy and I are celebrating our engagement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's watching Hell's Kitchen and eating a frozen pizza. There's a knock on the door. The "Just Say Yes" pamphlet balled up on his desk. He's using it as a napkin. Carl PAUSES the television show. He stands up and opens the do Peter STUMBLES IN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is an intervention.    You've missed your last event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Our engagement party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     I'm just really busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're watching Hell's Kitchen. That's not even B-list reality TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I don't want to go out tonight. Maybe I have to wake up early tomorrow. You don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bigger than that. You and Kath broke up over a year ago and you still aren't dating anyone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? So? I'm like a sexual camel. I only need it once every couple years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to be harsh but everyone's moving forward. It's like you're still wearing a Timex while the rest of us each have entry level Rolexes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wear a Rolex?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks for noticing. It's an Oyster Perpetual Yachtmaster. Sapphire crystal, self-winding. Four Gs. But that's not the point I'm trying to make.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I don't have an oyster watch. All you and Lucy and Kath do is sit around and talk about real estate and Crate and Barrel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong with Crate and Barrel? They have adorable stuff at reasonable prices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget Crate and Barrel. Maybe I'm just getting more mature. I don't need the lifestyle ever night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lifestyle? You have to have a life to have a style of life. You never leave your apartment. You never meet anyone new.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate meeting people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've become a complete cave dweller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a cave dweller. Just the other day, we all went to Summerfest and snuck backstage and you bet me I wouldn't steal something and so I stole a drumstick from that horrible Swedish hillbilly band. That's not very cave dweller of me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just the other day?   That was seven years ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's not possible -- I was already working at the bank by then.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You had started there three years earlier. Why you've worked at that place for so long is beyond me. You had so much potential. You shouldn't be a teller. You should be the guy who tells the guy who tells the teller what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (SHOCKED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been a teller at Southwest Bank for ten years? How the hell did that happen? (doing the math) Ten years... if I had had a child, he'd be toilet-trained by now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, he'd be in fourth grade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (starting to panic) I was making out with chicks by fourth grade. I was a little man by fourth grade. (THEN) Whatever. I don't need this shit right now. I'm an adult man. I can live my life as I see fit. Can you please leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pushes Peter out the door. Carl sits down on the cou He then unballs the "Just Say Yes" pamphlet. It features Indian man smiling beatifically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A banner across a stage that has a photo of the same Indi man smiling beatifically. We PAN DOWN to find Carl among crowd. Carl sits down next to a WIRY, CRUNCHY WOMAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this your first time at one of Sanji's lectures?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SCOFFING) Uh, yeah. (THEN) Have you been to this before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only like fifty-eight times. Sanji's a genius. Like seriously... he will blow your mind all over the goddamn room. He's like a mind grenade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I want that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh you do not. But you need it. And that's why you are here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool. Do you want anything from the refreshment area?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding? That processed shit will kill you faster than a pleasure cruise to Chernobyl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl heads over to the refreshment table. Once he's out o her sight, he sits down alone in a corner of the conferen room. Ethereal music begins to play over the loudspeakers People begin to sit. Carl sits down in the back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life.   We are all living it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl laughs.   No one else does.   The lights get rosier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (V.O.) (cont'd) Or are we? Change doesn't start on the surface. It's generated from consciousness. But where is consciousness generated from?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks around.   Everyone is nodding along with it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) From the external. And the external is manipulated through our choices. And our choices start with one word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The music ABRUPTLY SWITCHES to the opening beats of "Jump the Pointer Sisters. The rosy colored lights FLIP TO BRIG WHITE and SWEEP ACROSS THE CONVENTION CENTER ROOM. It is suddenly like a rock concert. SANJI (50s) BUSTS THROUGH T GIANT BANNER. The whole crowd starts CHEERING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instead of "Jump", Sanji's yelling "Yes!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) Say yes! For your life! Yes! Change starts now! Yes! Yes! Yes! Say it with me! SAY YES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanji pumps his fist in the air as lame indoor fireworks OFF. The crowd JUMPS ON THEIR FEET.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) Are you ready to open the door to yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am sorry, my friends.      But I cannot hear you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shhhhhhh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd quiets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) Now is the time when we must greet our new members. Who here is new? Please, do not be shy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman POINTS AT Carl.      The spotlight SWINGS OVER He is annoyed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on up, Future Yes Man!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's OK.     I'm just auditing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't audit life!      Now get on up here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm cool right here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I will come to you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanji runs off the stage and joins Carl in the back of th conference hall. The spotlights follow him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) What is your name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me guess, Carl. This was not your idea to come here, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can tell me, Carl.    We are all alone, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't exactly my idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought, Carl. And you think this is all bullshit, Carl, isn't that right, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there any other way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This whole thing seems retarded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you are stuck in your life, Carl? Am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't necessarily --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You once had a dream? You wanted to own a boat? A house? A fancy car? You wanted to a doctor, a lawyer... a business man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl nods, surprised at Sanji's incisiveness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) You wanted to be more than you are. And yet you have suddenly woken up to find life is passing you by. Am I right, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanji's suddenly getting to Carl. As Sanji talks to him, moment between them becomes more and more intimate. It should feel like the rest of the crowd has disappeared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's odd that ten years can pass just like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanji snaps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) Isn't it, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to do something for me, Carl. Tomorrow, I want you only to say yes. Can you do that for me? For one day, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not sure --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, Carl. Do it for me and you will be doing it for yourself. If you don't have the best day in ten years then I am the uncle of a monkey. Will you do it for me Carl? Just for a day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanji grabs Carl hand and PULLS HIM to his feet.   We PUL BACK and the crowd CHEERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Welcome to the world of yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fireworks and confetti go off.    The Wiry, Anxious Woman Carl a creepy thumbs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's asleep. The phone starts ringing.     Carl sleepil grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yello.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Carl, it's Peter. I just wanted to apologize about barging in yesterday. You were right. It's your life to live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't worry about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) Me, Lucy and Kath are all going out for brunch. You have any interest in joining?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, thanks for the invite, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you do it for me Carl?       Just for a day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BACK TO CARL AND PETER.       We CLOSE IN ON CARL'S MOUTH

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in slo-mo) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (clearly not wanting to) Yes. I will come to brunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stackers is a cutesie brunch place.      Carl walks up to Lucy and Kath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (AWKWARD) Morning, Carl. This is a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I've never seen you at brunch. Like ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You kidding? I love brunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, Peter, Lucy and Kath are still waiting with a big c of people to sit down for brunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do people wait an hour for breakfast? It's so hot and bright and we haven't even had coffee yet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't want to be here, you don't have to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I want to be here. I love waiting an hour for eggs. It's fun. Although I will point out that you have sunglasses which is probably making this wait a lot easier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oakleys, polarized lenses, indestructible. Two fifty but worth every penny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress comes up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lowell, party of five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of four people get up to be seated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were definitely before those Lowell people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate when people jump ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does no one ever say anything?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to be sitting so bad, why don't you say something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks up to the Waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Excuse me, but we were here before those people.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you weren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, we were.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have the list, dude.   The list doesn't lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Meanwhile, the customers the Waitress was going to seat a looking away, trying not to get involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this time the list lied.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's OK, Carl. It's just brunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to the people who are being seated) You all know that we were up before you! And you have to live with that knowledge through your delightful brunch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter pulls Carl away from the Waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on with you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want transparency in terms of the brunch seating order.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the customers who was being seated heads over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great. Now we're going to get into a fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We talked about what you said... you're right. You guys were here before us. Sorry we didn't pipe up sooner. We cool, brother?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SURPRISED) Yeah. We cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and the Brunch Dude punch fists and hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and his friends are sitting at a table.    Carl's sl bored as his friends discuss real estate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a two bedroom duplex with harbor views. It'd be perfect for you Kath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Washer/Dryer in the building?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (JEALOUS) I didn't realize you were looking to buy a place. I thought you and I would be renters to the end.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's a fancy lawyer making bank. It's about time she was buying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PLAYFUL) Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brunch Dude is seated near Carl. He gives him a thumb up. Carl gives a thumbs up right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the menus) What're you looking at?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bacon and eggs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How unadventurous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want an adventure first thing in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to tell you about my specials. We have a double fruit burnt sugar waffle. Any of you interested in that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alrighty. Then, on the savory side, we have a smoked whitefish omelet with hash browns on the side. Any takers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SURPRISED) You want both?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress writes that down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like toast with that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any side?    Bacon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sausage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turkey sausage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A side of our famous maple pancakes --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.    Someone's really hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee or juice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Coffee.    And juice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We also have smoothies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's friends look at him like a freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (turning towards his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What would you all like to order?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His friends are all looking at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has six dishes in front of him.     The Waitress com with a pepper mill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like some pepper?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waitress starts grinding pepper onto Carl's meal. It' starting to take a long time. She's grinding and grinding and grinding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She keeps grinding.    A pile of pepper's growing on his

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of Carl's food is covered piles of pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I've ever seen a waiter tap one of those pepper mills.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just addicted to the stuff. Chinese cultures say it's good for digestion. (THEN) You're all welcome to have some.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's... OK. Do you want a bite of mine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes a bite of Lucy's.      He then sips his coffee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Uch. Brunch coffee. Why can't they make it black without all this frothy shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because you ordered a latte.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's phone rings.   He answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Carl. We're a little short on our Saturday staff. I know this is going against ten years of precedent, but you have any interest in coming in today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think... there's any reason why I shouldn't? On a Saturday there's nothing I like more than the inside of a bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There really is something magical about this place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into Dunkin Donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like an Italian-inspired coffee flavoring?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sugar, Splenda or Nutrasweet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of them please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The confused Dunkin Donuts cashier loads up Carl's coffee

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're having a special on Munchkins?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks out of Dunkin Donuts, carrying a giant coffee several boxes of Munchkins. He walks by Renee, the cute g who hands out band fliers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want a flier? Oh, it's you.    Never mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I'll take a flier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes a flier.   Renee's surprised Carl's taking a f

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) (READING) The Flying Buttresses.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew after a year and a half of wearing you down, you'd give in. I'm Renee by the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee holds out her hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl. Cool. I like to thank everyone personally who comes to our performances. It gives it a nice intimate touch. See you soon Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns away, nervous that he's accepted her invitatio He takes a sip of his giant coffee and grimaces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl STUMBLES INTO work, hyper from the giant coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Morning, Carl. Thanks for coming in and being part of the Saturday banking experience. Oooh, Munchkins. Are those for the office, you dirty devil?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. I just though it would be a fun way to lighten things up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadly serious) You didn't approve this with petty cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent my own money on them...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kidding! Munchkins are always approved. Although, I can't reimburse you. (over the intercom) Today is free Munchkin day. That's right! Free Munchkin day!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Instantly Carl's cubicle is surrounded by fellow workers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl rules./You're the best./Finally I have a reason to live today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's greeting.   A MIDDLE-AGED MOTHERLY CUSTOMER comes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How may I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to speak to a loan specialist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: While loans aren't normally in my jurisdiction, I'd be happy to help you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's trying to keep up as the customer launches into intense finance-speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to refi my house and spend the capital on my personal business. I see you've got a 5.25 7 year ARM, but over at Chase they're offering 5.00 7 year ARM. Can you refi lower, like at 4.85 par example, or am I going to have to bring my beeswax elsewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?   That's it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yup.   What's your business?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Selling beanie babies online.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Adorable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: More like highly profitable.    I've crunched the numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman hands over a scrapbook that's been decorated wi construction paper and pictures of beanie babies. Carl op the scrapbook. It's filled with numbers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me just get final approval on this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gets up and walks over to Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stands before Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a teller, not a loan specialist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I know, so if you think this is a bad idea for a loan that's fine but can you please tell her yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her business plan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman grabs the business plan and starts reading it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Inta-maresting. My grandma loves beanie babies. Although unfortunately, we have a minimum loan floor of ten thousand dollars. She only wants five.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's silly. How're you supposed to start a tiny business if you can't get a tiny business loan?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't make the rules, I just break `em. (THEN) I don't break them. I just wanted to rhyme. If she wants us to loan her ten thousand or more, great. Otherwise, I think her only option is a loan shark.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits back down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NERVOUS) So, what'd he say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you maybe have any interest in borrowing ten thousand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't afford the payments on ten. You can't do five thousand? This is the fifth bank I've been to. Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course we can.    One moment please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gets up. He heads over to the soda machine and buys Diet Coke. He then heads over to Norman's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Diet Coke?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh, thank you. Feed the addiction, am I right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They clink Diet Cokes. Norman DOWNS his entire Diet Coke one swallow. Carl then heads over to the photocopier. He watches Norman out of the corner of his eye. After a coup minutes, Norman gets up and HEADS INTO THE BATHROOM. Carl heads back over to Norman's desk and SWIPES THE LOAN APPR STAMP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl returns to the loan desk and STAMPS HER FORM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's approved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bank Customer HUGS Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much! I promise I won't let you down, Mr. Kendall. On me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bank Customer hands Carl a panda beanie baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Marge. We don't like to make other customers jealous so can we keep this between you and I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.     Aren't you just a dear?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bank Customer leaves.    Carl can't help but be touch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's at the loan desk.    Norman comes over, looking gr

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, could I see you for a moment?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl nervously walks into his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl nervously sits before Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Earlier today, you showed some initiative. And I loved it. What do you say to a permanent spot at the loan desk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seems like a lot of responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a loan specialist a lot more than we need a teller and greeter. Besides, you'd have a starting salary of 52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, dollars. What is this Darfur? (waving to an African- American employee) Sorry, Patricia, that was inappropriate. (then, back to Carl) Of course grand. To celebrate, next Saturday, I'm throwing a party. Dress up as your favorite character from Heroes. (WHISPERING) Save the cheerleader, save the world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next Saturday... sounds great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't dress as Hiro.    I got dibs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wouldn't think of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl heads back to the loan desk, happy about his promoti

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks in the door. Peter, Lucy and Rooney, who's clearly been there for a little while, comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Kendall? Out in the world? Are you some kind of ghost? Am I having a religious vision?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe it. Because this guy just got a promotion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congrats, Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well let's get you a beer. You want a 20 ouncer? I'm just joking - -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney looks at Peter and Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A normal-sized beer is fine with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm done actually.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two twenty ouncers and one tiny, little beer, barkeep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please don't call me that.   We're not in the middle ages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Carl) I can't believe you're out here. I'm giddy. I feel like a child whose best friend has strict Chinese parents who never let him come out and play but now his Chinese parents are away for the Chinese New Year. You have any interest in pounding this shit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney picks up his beer and begins pounding the twenty ouncer. Carl reluctantly pounds it as well. Rooney slams his on the table. Carl puts it on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you say we have another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are a beast!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it's been fun watching you guys recreate freshman year, but Peter and I have some furniture errands to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's a little drunk now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a good day yuppifying your lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a sofa, Carl.     We're not buying a second home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever, yuppy sellouts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was good seeing you.    You should come out more often.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (kind of pleading) Please don't leave me here with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Lucy laugh, not realizing that Carl is serious. They leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Rooney are really drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have not been this drunk in years! The room is spinning in a bad way!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Barkeep! Two more double pints s'il vous plait!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was the last `barkeep.'   I am cutting you off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well fortunately you're not the only game in town! Let's go to some place with class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney and Carl are in a Senor Frogs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's the class?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They wear uniforms here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SENOR FROG'S WAITRESS comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jello shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Rooney do jello shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl and Rooney downing more jello shots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl and Rooney drinking beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl and Rooney are drunkenly staring at a nearby grou girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) That girl is hot. Or at least she seems hot. I'm kind of too drunk to tell. Right now, honestly, you seem hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am hot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another jello shot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL                               ROONEY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.                               I think I'm done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl downs the jello shot.     He stumbles a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Senor Frog's famous karoake contest is starting now! Sign up and sweep us off our feet!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gotta do karoake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl STUMBLES over to the Senor Frog's DJ.     He's losin control and he likes it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sign me up, bitch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We've got our first victim... I mean, singer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: The opening notes of White Town's "Your Woman"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs the microphone and heads out into the crowd. (NOTE TO READER: As you read this part, I recommend liste to White Town's "Your Woman." It will bring it to life in way that words on a page cannot do it justice.)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (singing/talking with an odd English accent) Just tell me what you've got to say to me, I've been waiting for so long to hear the truth, It comes as no surprise at all you see, So cut the crap and tell me that we're through. Now I know your heart, I know your mind, You don't even know you're being unkind, So much for all your highbrow Marxist ways, Just use me up and then you walk away, Boy you can't play me that way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl heads over to the HOT GIRL and begins SERENADING HER She thinks it's kind of funny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Well I guess what you say is true, I could never be the right kind of girl for you, I could never be your woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gets really close to the Hot Girl's face and then CO pulls away for the bridge of the song. During the awesome bridge, Carl does some fantastic dance moves. Or rather, moves that you think are fantastic when you're drunk out your mind. The Hot Girl laughs at his antics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Well I guess what they say is true, I could never spend my life with a man like you, I could never be your woman. I could never be your woman. I could never be your woman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl lands on one knee in front of the Hot Girl. The crow CHEERS FOR HIM. The Hot Girl's LARGE BOYFRIEND gets up cl to Carl. Everyone is very, very drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Were you just flirting with my girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (re: the Hot Girl) It depends -- is that your girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, c'mon. Be cool.    He was just screwing around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let me handle this, Crystal. (to Carl) So, you want to have sex with my girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I do.     Very much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you starting a fight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Carl, let's go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then bring it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Carl doesn't really know what to do so he slaps him across the face the way a woman would slap a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me bringing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Brutish Boyfriend PUNCHES Carl in the head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) I'm too drunk to feel!  I'm like Darkman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl HEADBUTTS the guy. They get into a dirty, drunken tussle. Both of them are trying to hit the other one in t groin region. Bouncers DESCEND ON THEM and PULL THEM APAR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Rooney are outside.    Carl's nursing his wounds They are very, very drunk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You popped that guy!    He didn't know what hit him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You do not cross Carl Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hot Girl STUMBLES out of Senor Frog's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey. I'm sorry about Domingo. He likes to think he's my boyfriend but he's not. You're cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hot Girl KISSES Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOT GIRL (cont'd) (CONT'D) Want to go some place private?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Light is streaming in through the window. Carl opens his eyes. He's in bad shape. He looks over to see the Hot Gir finishing getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My fiance called. He was like really sorry about last night.      I have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your fiance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Domingo. The guy who punched you in the face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you said you two weren't even dating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were broken up last night.      It was fun hanging out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hot Girl kisses Carl on the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HOT GIRL (cont'd) I made some coffee. It's in the kitchen. Sorry for leading you on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Hot Girl LEAVES.    Carl smiles.    That was awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl runs to the conference room.      The Just Say Yes s has been packed up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks up to the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi... is there a Sanji Gupta staying here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks down the hallway. He knocks on Room 125. After couple minutes of shuffling around, Sanji opens the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Carl.    The guy from yesterday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course, of course!      Please come in!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl comes into Sanji's hotel room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) Would you like a cup of coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No thanks. I just wanted to thank you for that inspiration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fantastic. So how do you plan on continuing with your journey?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, just living every day to it's fullest. And, like, learning to continue to experience life or whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outstanding, Carl. Except for one THING: (suddenly intense) You are completely bullshitting me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just said I'm going to keep experiencing life. I thought you'd be happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're like a cigarette addict, Carl. Except you're addicted to boredom. On the way in here, Carl, I offered you a coffee and you refused. Perhaps that would have been the most delicious cup of coffee you would have ever had. Who's to say? Not you, Carl, because you said no! Anyone can quit smoking for a day. But for a lifetime? No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So what should I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanji PULLS OUT a contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behold, Carl, -- the Maniyesto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes the Maniyesto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the document) 1) Until New Year's Eve, I must say yes. 2) The yes cannot distort the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (EXPLAINING) You cannot say "Yes, the world is flat" because that is an untruth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the document) 3) If someone discovers you are a yes man, you do not have to say yes to them. 4) To avoid yes, you cannot avoid contact. Therefore, you must always answer your phone, the door, your postal mail, your email, etc and so on and so forth. 5) You must choose a yesponsor to keep you on the straight and narrow. (to Sanji) Who should that be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A close friend who will not tell a soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (reading the document) 5) I hereby void the "do you want" loophole. (to Sanji) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If someone asks you "do you want to go to the art museum" and you do not want to, you may not use this lack of desire as an excuse to not go. And finally, a warning. (SPOOKILY) If you say `no', even once, even for a cup of coffee, be prepared to lose every single little thing you've gained. (THEN) So what do you say, Carl? (WHISPERING) What do you say?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say... yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl signs the Maniyesto.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl signs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) And here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl signs again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SANJI (cont'd) And initial here. And here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this like a legal document?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kind of. And finally, my friend, please hold out your hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl holds out his hand. Sanji PULLS OUT an iron brand that's been heating over a hot pot and BRANDS CARL'S PALM

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: AHHHHHHHH!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That should heal by New Year's. Until then, you are a Yes Man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at his palm.       In the center of the palm, branded a `YES.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is sitting across from Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a whole year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesterday I got promoted and beat up and hooked up with this chick and I have a massive headache today and I still might throw up, but I don't care because it was the best time I've had in like forever. Not to mention finding out that, despite what you might think, smoked whitefish in an omelette is delicious, even if covered in a thick layer of pepper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But for a whole year?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't   understand. I got promoted.    Do you know how long I've been   waiting for some kind of financial   step forward? I said `yes' and   it arrived.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, someone sounds like they're yuppifying their life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me for wanting an appliance in my kitchen besides a hot pot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no way you can do this for a whole year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's where you come in.   You're my "Yesponsor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yesponsor?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like in AA. I need you to hold me to it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You aren't going to last for more than a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I look forward to proving you wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter and Carl shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Nice suit. If I move up anymore at the bank, I might need a few.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cavalli. Silk and cotton blend. Seven fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy comes over and kisses Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My girlfriends are being such bitches. It's been two weeks and no one's offered to throw me a wedding shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's too bad. I'm sure someone will offer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (SARCASTIC) Hey, you want to throw my wedding shower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter turns to Carl, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreading it) I'd be happy to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was kidding. Wedding showers are thrown by girls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's sexist. Please.      I insist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.    That means a lot to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy hugs Carl. Carl looks over Lucy's shoulder at Peter shakes his head. Rooney comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was some good times last night. You back for more?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got no cash. You mind spotting me and my buddies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney points to FOUR BARFLIES sitting at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, didn't bring my wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter turns to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks up to the bar.     Peter's snickering behind h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) What kind of beer do you guys want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As long as you're buying, I want a Grey Goose straight up./Kir Royale/Whatever's in that dusty bottle back there that you never take down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl wakes up.   He looks at the tattooed "Yes" on his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl goes through a series of junk mail flyers for credit cards. He VERY CAREFULLY fills each one of them out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into Dunkin Donuts.    Before the cashier can anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Black coffee, large.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cutting her off) To have a wonderful day?    I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns to see a giant poster with the words "DO YOU W A MOCHA CARAMEL COOLATA?" Carl turns back to the cashier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) (RESIGNED) And could I also have a Mocha Caramel Coolata.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With whipped cream?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks out of Dunkin Donuts, carrying a frozen coffee drink and several boxes of Munchkins. He walks by Renee a wordlessly takes a flier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, give that back.    You already took one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the hurt in taking another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Destroys the Earth. Also, they cost me ten cents a copy. Besides, are you even going to come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course.     I couldn't say `no.'

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As he walks away...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Even if I wanted to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you tonight, Carl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits at his cubicle, and flips on his email. In the background, we see various SUPER HAPPY EMPLOYEES eating t Dunkin Donuts that Carl has brought. We see on the screen another email from the King of Nigeria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear deposed King of Nigeria. I would love to help you anyway I can with your confidential transaction. Please let me know what I can do. Yours, Carl Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks the next email.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Would I like Viagra? Yes, I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl writes back to the Viagra. ANGLE ON THE SCREEN: The next email is from PERSIANWIFEFINDER.COM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) (CONT'D) Do I want a Persian wife? Perhaps I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl clicks onto the Persianwifefinder.com and starts uploading his profile. Norman walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Norman, would you say I prefer Iranian, Pakistani, Bangladeshi or no preference?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's reading his email when a HIGH SCHOOL GIRL sits dow

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You Carl Kendall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hear that you do small loans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marge. The lady my mom buys her beanie babies from.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told her not to say anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only need five hundred bucks. I'm starting college next year and I need it for books. I can't afford them now but I can pay them off over the course of the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks to make sure Norman's not around then he stamp her form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: HIGH SCHOOL GIRL (cont'd) Thank you so much, Mr. Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks down the street, taking fliers from anyone who passes them out. We do QUICK CUTS of him with various peo as he walks down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I might have some stuff to pawn./I will definitely check out your gun selection./I would like to learn Korean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're interested, intro to Korean is starting right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's sitting in a Korean class with several businessmen

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean, with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Hello, my name is Carl.   What is your name?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stands at the back of a basically empty dive bar, nursing a beer. There's a makeshift stage at the front of the bar. "The Flying Buttresses" are setting up their equipment, including a giant clear plastic harp. Renee st up to the microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Jake, Penelope, Carl and Rodrigo. We are the Flying Buttresses!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Their four audience members cheer. The drummer bangs his sticks together and the band launches in. They are terrib Like really terrible. Renee sings in a high-pitched voice that she probably thinks sounds like Tori Amos, but sound more like a dog whistle. If you've heard the singer, Joan Newsom, well that's who she's emulating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) (SINGING) Everyday, the unicorns they play/Among lingonberry fields/They silently bay/The king has no crown/Just a vest of grass/The queen loves the Jester/The Jester has the last laugh. (CHORUS) You are my minotaur/With your cloven hooves!/Half man, half horse/You are all boy to me

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks at the three other audience members. They are nodding along. Also, one of them is dressed like a Court Jester.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee's whisper singing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) A witches cauldron/burns hot as hell/As her crooked hand/Brews a love spell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee's singing a power ballad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) I! Am!   A! Fairy!/I! Like!    To Fly!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four people in the audience clap hard as she finishes Renee takes a huge bow and motions to her fellow band mat Carl, not knowing how to politely react to the horror sho just witnessed, claps along. Renee gets off the stage and walks over to the bar, right next to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice, show Renee. One virgin mint soda coming right up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I hit a high enough octave in Fairy Dream Song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I disagree. I think you hit some pretty high octaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I can hit like way higher. (as she speaks her voice goes higher and higher) Like check this out. I think this tone might be more appropriate for my water nymph song?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (speaking in a low voice) I don't know -- I've known some water nymphs with big balls. (no reaction) From the high level of testosterone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An awkward moment where Renee doesn't react and Carl thin he may have offended her. Suddenly she starts laughing spazzily hard. Carl smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've got to write a song about that. I could call it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "Big Balled Water Nymph"?       It's a working title.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it.     I can work with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The drummer, a guy named LEEORE, shouts down to Renee fro the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um, excuse me, but we have to clear the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta clear. (JOKING) Unless of course, you want to help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.   I love clearing stages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl helps a surprised Renee clear the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has helped Renee fit the giant harp into the back of ancient Volvo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, thanks for coming, Carl.      I must bid good night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So early?     It's only 8:00?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I lead a jogging, photo group for people who want to both exercise and practice photography.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a photographer too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Amateur, but yeah.    I show every Friday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) If you want to do some artistic calisthenics join us tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What time do you leave?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Five.   So we can see the sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. I haven't seen the sunrise maybe ever. (RESIGNED) I guess now I'll be doing that tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, it's beautiful. Makes great photos. Nice meeting you, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee gets in her Volvo and drives off.      Carl walks o

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You interested in learning Spanish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes the flier from the Flier Guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks down the street, now holding a zillion fliers. Carl gets a tap on the shoulder. REVEAL Kath standing the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thinking of learning a couple foreign languages?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Kath. Would you like one? I'm going to learn Swahili.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe next week. There's someone you should probably meet. Carl, this is Seb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very tall, very blond, Nordic looking man approaches Ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seb?    What is that?   Swedish?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat. Seb puts his hand on Kath's back.   Carl notices th and is not particularly happy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEB (cont'd) I've heard a lot about you, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seb's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEB (cont'd) Sorry, sweetie. I've got to take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seb walks off and answers his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're on a date then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Met him at my firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's very tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess so, yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seb returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it was nice meeting you, Seb. So I'll be going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl starts to walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unless... you'd like to join us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stops in his tracks. He mouths the word "fuck." Carl turns. Kath nods at Carl as in, "You don't have to join u

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEB (cont'd) It was good meeting you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd love to. Join you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seb, Carl and Kath are sitting at dinner. It is incredibl awkward. Kath and Seb are clearly incredibly pissed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how did you guys meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I told you. Through the firm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A waiter arrives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like to order some wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CUT TO LATER -- Carl, Kath and Seb are now slightly drunk However, it is a quiet, angry drunk, not a fun-loving dru They are still sitting in silence. Seb turns to Kath and starts saying something quietly to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this is good. (CHUCKLING) I was walking past Pizza Hut the other day, and for a second I was sure the sign said "Pizza Hat." And then I thought, wouldn't it be funny if there was a shop that sold hats shaped like pizzas? (beat, weakly) You know. Because it sounds like "Pizza Hut" only it's a hat shop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Carl, why don't you just eat your fish and fuck off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl puts the rest of his meal in his mouth, gets up from table and walks out of the restaurant. As he leaves, he smiles to himself. His phone rings. He sees it's Rooney o the Caller ID.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl answers the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up Carl? It's Rooney!      What do you say we grab a couple brewskis?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl flips on his computer. He's trashed.     He has a bu emails. He clicks on the email.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear   brother Carl, Thank you for your   last note you sent me. But we must   move quickly. I must have your   bank details right now. Send them   to me. Your Associate, Omar, King   of Nigeria

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (while typing) Dear Omar, While I appreciate the gravity of your situation, perhaps a goodwill branch is in order. Could you perhaps loan me a million and take it out of my final cut? Then I will happily send you my bank details. Sincerely, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl then flips on persianwifefinder.com.    A PERSIAN CA GENIE comes onto the screen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sa'laam, Carl. You have sixty-five winks. Allah Akbar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The screen is suddenly filled with pictures of Persian wo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's alarm goes off. Carl hits it and sits up. He grabs his head and then runs to the bathroom and throws up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee, along with several other amateur photographers in sweat suits, have gathered. They all have big cameras aro their necks. Carl walks up to them. He does not look good

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.     You look tired.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, it is five in the morning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mammals are meant to be up at dawn. It's how we're built biologically. Where's your camera?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl realizes he forgot his camera.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I'd use my phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl pulls out his camera cell phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Awesome idea. So light.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I thought.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee, Carl and the group of amateur jogging photographer start jogging. Carl can barely keep up with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) Oooh, pretty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she passes a flower, Renee snaps a photo of it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group reaches the lake as the sun rises. They all sna photos. Carl finds himself snapping photos on his camera. He accidentally snaps one of Renee with the sun behind he She looks pretty in the photo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright!    Enough standing around!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee starts jogging again. Carl starts after her and the abruptly doubles over and throws up on the ground. Renee the other jogging/photographers snap photos of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits across from an Iranian women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was delightful meeting you, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As it was meeting you Farinoush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Although I must say I was surprised to discover that you are in no way Persian. Nor are you six foot two. You should change that on your profile.
