dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do.    Should I call you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, I want a tall guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Iranian Woman leaves, passing Lucy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Farinoush Azzam. Great girl, but I don't think we're right for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How'd you meet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PersianWifeFinder.com. (ignoring her odd look) Let's talk wedding shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I know it's just a wedding shower, so who cares really? And it's like so lame? But I've made an appointment at a stationery store. Are you going to totally kill me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dripping with sarcasm) You kidding? I love stationery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy gets up.   Carl follows her.   He does not look happ

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy and Carl are looking over a book of stationery with STATIONERY PROPRIETESS. Carl can't concentrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This one is nice. I especially love it in cream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ooooh, pretty. What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looks good to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastic annoyance) Thanks for your opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's always difficult to get the husband-to-be's opinion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (derisive laughter) I'm not marrying him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just helping throw the shower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh. What's the party going to be like? Sometimes it helps to know that before you pick an invitation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing special. Just hors d'oeuvres and wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, meanwhile, is looking through the book of invitatio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at this -- Bridal Bingo. What's Bridal Bingo?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bingo, except you yell out embarrassing facts about the bride and whoever fills their card first wins.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That sounds fun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not doing Bridal Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about a calendar shower?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can we concentrate at the task at hand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you even know what a calendar shower is? Maybe a calendar shower is awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Every guest gets assigned a month and brings a gift that the bride and groom can use during that month.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's kind of cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think that's really cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's starting to get really into it. He turns the page sees an invitation decorated with animals labeled "Knight White Armor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Look at this one -- "Knights in White Armor."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bride and groom ride in on a white stallion.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have got to do that.   Like it's not even a choice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That seems a little extreme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You only get married once.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your friend happens to be right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really good at this. You mind helping me with the wedding invitations?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's sitting across from an Arab Guy at the loan desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love cell phones. I breathe cell phones. I own, myself, thirty-five cell phones. My brother is an idiot and he's selling cell phones hand over fist. What do you have? A Nokia 9850?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Arab Guy goes to grab Carl's phone.   He sees the pho Renee on the phone's wallpaper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARAB GUY (cont'd) Oooh, pretty lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs his phone back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Eighty five hundred.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stamps his form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was with my sister? And we had this lemonade stand? And we sold like a hundred cups of lemonade in two days? And so I want to expand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TEN YEAR OLD GIRL (cont'd) All I need is three thousand dollars?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stamps her form.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give me the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You promise you'll pay it back?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Basically.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stamps his form.    Norman comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I speak to you, Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman sits across from Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you're doing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What am I doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're loaning below our minimum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl doesn't know what to say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMAN (cont'd) You thought I wouldn't notice the paperwork? I'm not the regional manager because I ignore the details.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, but it's absurd that if you need a small amount of money you have to go to a loan shark. Only rich people can pay back loans over ten grand. A bank's job is not to just help the rich. It's to help anyone with a dream achieve it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know. These microloans are pretty interesting. So I'll you spearhead a little pilot program at the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you so much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If corporate finds out, you're the one who's getting fired. So keep it quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl mimes zipping up his mouth and throwing away the key

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney sits down across from Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need a loan for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't. I was wondering if you were around tonight to help me move?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you hire movers?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it's cheaper to ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney and Carl are looking at a fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you carry the fridge alone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MOMENTS LATER Carl is carrying the fridge down the stairs He FALLS down the stairs with the fridge. Carl looks up a Rooney who's at the top of the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   Do you want to help at all?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish I could, but I hurt my back trying to move that fridge.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has put the last box into the moving van.   Rooney a his mom are hugging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to miss you, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm going to miss you, ma.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't watch you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His mom goes into her house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you moving?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rooney looks at Carl and smiles.   Carl's eyes go wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: "JUMP" by the Pointer Sisters

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl's taking Korean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) (in Korean) [What is the weather like in Pyongyang?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- At Southwest Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need a volunteer to think up local marketing ideas

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl raises his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has put up signs on the bank window that say "Pet-a- Puppy" day. There's a box of puppies in the bank. Custome are streaming into the bank to pet puppies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We see Carl's CALENDAR filling up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- A ton of different kinds of credit cards are POPPING THROUGH HIS MAIL SLOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl's taking Spanish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Spanish) [I like to drive with my mother.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The door to the language center opens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl walks towards work. He sees the same group of fly guys and DUCKS DOWN an alleyway. We now see that to avoid the flyer guys he uses a series of alleys and fire escape crossing roofs, even jumping between two buildings so he avoid being approached.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- At Southwest Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We need someone to be a weekend cashier.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's hand shoots up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl walks out of a movie with a woman who's in a head scarf. He awkwardly hugs her. REVEAL that the movie they watched is Saw III.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl's at THE NOTE singing along to Renee's band's son He and the "Jester" audience member do shots together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl's walking around a florist shop with Lucy. She points to a small bouquet of white flowers. Carl points t giant heart-shaped ice sculpture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- We see Carl having to write in tiny letters on his calendar because it's so full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- At Southwest Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMAN (cont'd) We need a volunteer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's hand shoots up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NORMAN (cont'd) -- to be in charge of day care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CUT TO Carl with a bunch of kids. All the kids are folding brand new dollar bills into paper airplanes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- CUT TO Carl walking down the street, a big smile on hi face, taking everyone's fliers as per usual. He walks pas CULTY GUY named TONY who's passing out books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to change your life through Mahayana Buddhism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes one of the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY (cont'd) Would you like to have tea and discuss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm kind of in a rush...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My place is right around the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's sitting awkwardly on the floor across from Tony. are both drinking tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is only through the four noble truths and the destruction of desire that we can end suffering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, that's really neat. (awkward beat) So, thanks for the books and the jasmine tea and the vegan curry, but I have to go --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you like Dionne Warwick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony flips on Dionne Warwick's "I Say a Little Prayer."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY (cont'd) Now she had style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was really great meeting you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C'mon, Carl. Shake your groove thang.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony pulls Carl up.    Carl starts to awkwardly shake his groove thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY (cont'd) I like big guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I really have to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony grabs Carl and kisses him full on the lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Want to go into my bedroom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE IN on Carl's face.      He looks down on the "Yes" on his palm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very quiet) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Tony head into his bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you have any candles?      I just love candles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony instantly pulls out candles and lights them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about wine?       Like a bottle of Beaujolais?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I only have Beaujolais Nouveau.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony pulls out a bottle of wine and two glasses.     Tony in to kiss Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have herpes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Upstairs or downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Downstairs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Front door or back door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a swinging door!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just give it!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony pushes Carl down onto the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's sitting across from Peter in Peter's fancy law off They're each eating burgers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the kitten?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK to reveal a kitten on Peter's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just adopted her. If you're interested, they're giving them away in front of Petco.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want a kitten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Neither did I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Andy Solomon on line two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, asshole, we're not talking until you sign that goddamn contract.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (cont'd) (totally normal) I spoke to Kath. I hear you met her boyfriend, Seb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seems like a nice guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was upset you went on her date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked me to join them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're taking this too far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no choice. I'm a yes man. I must say yes. If Seb asks me to join them on their date, I must. If some dude asks me for a loan I have to give it to them even if it's clearly never going to be paid back. If a guy asks me into his bedroom, I must hook up with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hooked up with a dude?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's like hooking up with a strong woman. I honestly don't see what the big deal is. (back on his yes rant) I am guided by yes. Yes has become my superpower. And let me tell, yes is turning out to be a pretty sweet deal. Now if you'll excuse me I'm late for Korean class.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You hate Korean food.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's no reason to write off an entire, vibrant culture. See you later, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl heads off, the kitten under his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks around a photography gallery. Renee's photos a up. They are terrible photos, since they were taken while she was jogging. Their subjects are blurry. Some of them are half in the photo and half out. The featured photo is Carl throwing up on the ground.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You really are displaying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's probably my best photo ever. My collages aren't bad. But personally, I think I excel at pottery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee POINTS to a LARGE, BROWN PLATE that looks like poo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow. That's really big. How do you have time for all this stuff?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you have time to come to every one of my rocks shows even the one in Fairfield county that was seventy-five miles from here? I almost skipped that one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You gave me the flier, so I had to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At first I thought you were a weird stalker and I was scared. But now I think you're just a really shy dude with a crush. And while it's been suspenseful to see when/if you'd ask me out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to go out sometime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: By the way, I do other stuff besides follow you around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I take Korean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, what do you say we do Korean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's eating across from Renee. He can't stand the food. He grimaces with every bite, but manages to choke it down

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want any more squid hot pot? It's really good here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm good.   To have some more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee spoons a huge amount of squid onto both their plate

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) So, all this art you create.   What do you want to do with it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you mean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like, do you want to open a store?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where I can sell my photos and pottery? Of course not. They're terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's surprised that she knows this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're not terrible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, they're awful.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think you're being hard on yourself --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not asking for sympathy. My voice is way too high-pitched, my pottery looks like poo, and my photos are blurry and subjectless. But who gives a shit? Not everything needs a goal. The world is a playground. You know that as a kid but then somewhere along the way everyone forgets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (as if    telling a secret) Besides, I    can't open a store. My big master    plan is to take a trip around the    world.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When?   Like in a couple years?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bought a ticket for four months from now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: People always talk about that, but you're actually doing it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, I'm terrified. (THEN)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about you? Do you like the bank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's lame, but you know, it's pretty funny. My boss Norman always throws theme parties.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So if it's lame why do you work there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because... it's actually not lame. (REALIZING)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just gave the answer I've automatically given for years. I'm actually enjoying the bank for the first time maybe ever. I started this pilot program that gives out microloans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like say you need three hundred bucks to pay for paint so you can start a house painting business. Rather than paying a loan shark who charges you 300%, now you can come to Southwest Bank. Whatever. It's kind of dorky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That actually sounds really cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The waitress comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) I'm stuffed. But I would love to wrap this up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean, with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [We are very fat. But can I please have this food made mobile?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you say we hit this crazy party?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Funny, not crazy.    My boss is white noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: White noise?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, like totally boring.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know anyone who's totally boring. Crack a person's shell -- there's always something creepy underneath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman opens the door. He's dressed as the Japanese character Hiro from the show Heroes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl! Welcome. Or should I say, uerukamu!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going on?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wouldn't bother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't tell her? This is a dress-up as your favorite character from Heroes. Do you watch?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I currently don't have a television.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman stares at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know what to do with that information. There are drinks, chips, dips, various and sundry noshes. I entreat you to make friends. Let's get this party started!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very quiet.    A couple people mill about.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to stay long.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a party. Let's socialize.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee walk up to a MOUSEY GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Carl.     This is Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey.     I'm Khatoon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's complete silence.    Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHATOON (cont'd) Do I know you from somewhere?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you listed on Persianwifefinder.com?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee laughs.    Carl fake laughs with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KHATOON (cont'd) Seriously, though, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how do you know Norman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Karate Club.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman comes in with more chips.   There are now about te times as many snacks as guests.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Baked Lays people!   It is on!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're in a karate club?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's standing around Norman. They've laid several pieces of wood out over a coffee table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman!    Norman! Norman!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman KARATE CHOPS the wood in half.   The guests cheer. Norman takes a big bow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispering to Carl) Told ya there was something weird under that white noise shell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee leaves Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're totally on persianwifefinder.com.   SultanCarl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns to Norman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (changing the subject) Khatoon, Norman! You guys should spar!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Khatoon and Norman start to spar. Carl sits back, smiling JASON, a cynical guy who's slightly drunk, sidles up besi Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, isn't that cute? We've got a full match on. Hey, I'm Jason.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Carl.    What do you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Work for the INS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cool.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate it. Everyday I have to dash some poor guy's dream. I'm a professional dream dasher.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can't be that bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other day, I turned down a guy who had literally been a professor at the University of Cuba.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jason's sitting across from a CUBAN PROFESSOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? But I've already lived here for five years. I've received a steady paycheck and paid taxes for five years. I speak fluent English. I can't go back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry but no can do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've passed the citizenship test ten times. I bet you couldn't pass that test.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're probably right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know the location of the Spanish-American war?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spain?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: America?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Spainerica?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are an insult to your country.

dialogues.text: I sent him back to Cuba.       I send them all back.

dialogues.text: If you hate your job so much, why do you do it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I have to eat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself, in wonder) You're a no man.

dialogues.text: Beat.   Carl makes a difficult decision.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not supposed to tell anyone this except for my Yesponsor, but you can change your life. I've changed mine. If I tell you how, will you promise not to tell anyone?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (sarcastically whispering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure, whatever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say yes. To everything.    Say Yes More. It's that simple.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dramatic beat.   Jason finishes his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's the most retarded idea I've ever heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What did I miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: You work for the ASPCA?

dialogues.text: The room is piled floor to ceiling with boxes.   Renee st to go through the boxes.

dialogues.text: You don't need to do that.

dialogues.text: You have a lot of Mexican Viagra.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a congenital heart thing it helps. And it's cheaper than the stuff that's made here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You better not be a criminal. Because one time I dated this guy who jacked cars for a living and I did not enjoy living on the edge as much as I thought I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's cheaper to buy in bulk.    Is that a crime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A hundred boxes of Mexican prescription drugs borders on something vaguely criminal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) Well, are you going to make out with me or what?

dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You must be Renee. I have heard so much about you. Can I watch?

dialogues.text: Carl doesn't know what to say.   Before he has to say yes

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you can't watch.

dialogues.text: Renee and Carl lie next to each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know what I would love?    A massage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give great massages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl starts massaging her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oooh.   Yeah. Oooh, right there.

dialogues.text: Carl stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) Don't stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl continues massaging her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's still massaging her.    He stops.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) Can you please keep massaging?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl starts massaging again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's massaging. His hands are really cramping up.   She asleep. He stops massaging.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) (while asleep) Please keep massaging, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl starts massaging again, wincing while he does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's sitting across from a LARGE MAN. Carl's hands are like claws. A line of people waits to speak with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How much does a Schwinn cost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred fifty three dollars. It'll really help me get my one hour delivery business off the ground. I've tried on foot. I only have a two mile radius.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Done and done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stamps the package.      Norman comes over to the lo

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, the boys upstairs are here to speak with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?   Because I have a thing at one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He asked for you specifically. Ixnay on the small loans-ay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks over. He sees the President (from the beginnin of the movie) sitting in the conference room. Carl gets nervous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into the conference room.     The bank preside CHRIS PARKER, motions to a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl Kendall? I'm Chris Parker. President of Southwest Bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I actually met you when I was just a teller.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no recollection of it at

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course! (reading from a binder) Pet-a-Puppy day. Free cookie day. Free half hour on the bank's punching bag day. You've upped walk-in traffic by 35%. Not only that -- you've also taken charge of corporate day care. I like a team player.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's phone buzzes.    The caller ID says LUCY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But then I got suspicious. What drives a man in his mid to late thirties who's still at the absolute lowest level of our corporate family? Generous helpfulness? Or raging revenge?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Generous helpfulness?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is when I got the numbers from your loan desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl turns white. Carl's phone buzzes again.    The text

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've given out over 682 below minimum loans. One of them was literally for fifteen dollars and eighty seven cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Janice Peabody's ant farm rental business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you explain yourself?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've started a microloan project. I figure that if someone needs less than ten grand why should they go to a loan shark when they can come to a legitimate banking institution?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the paperwork makes any profit moot. Unless you're raiding our coffers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.   I wouldn't do that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would if I could, so why wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris laughs. Carl laughs. Chris abruptly stops laughing. So does Carl. Carl's phone buzzes again. The text says

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS PARKER (cont'd) But then I looked closer at the numbers. 85% of the loan recipients have been paying them off according to the bank's schedule. Not just that, but 72% of that group have returned as regular full loan customers. This is both a moneymaker and good for the community. That like never happens!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're the kind of person we want in corporate. We're taking some clients on a golfing trip. You golf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You free tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you are. I better watch my back around you, Carl Kendall. Soon you'll be taking my job. See you on the links.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris Parker grabs Carl's hand and shakes it.   Carl RUNS of the office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl RUNS up to the bakery.   Lucy's outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry -- bank meeting stuff.
