dialogues.text: Lucy and Carl wander around a fancy bakery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never heard of a Wedding Shower cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to have one. Modern Bride calls them a necessity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Sorry, Luce. Work stuff. (sotto into phone) Yeah, I can definitely be at the blood bank in twenty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hangs up.   Lucy suddenly starts crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Are you OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, it's just you've been so great at all this while my husband- to-be has been completely absent. Do you have time to grab a cup of tea?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Lucy are each drinking tea.   The only other peo in the tea room are groups of women.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he scared to get married?    Is that why he doesn't care?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Peter. He's a man's man. He cares, he just doesn't know how to show it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know how to show it. A wedding is a huge deal. I'm so scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You guys are perfect for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that and yet I'm still so scared.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe if you're just honest with him about how you're feeling it'll be OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He can be just so closed off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, the bank, you know? (sotto into phone) The UFO conference is tonight? No, that's fine, I'll definitely be there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've been so good to me. I've really come to depend on you. I want to pay you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter tells me you might have some disposable income these days.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For some reason, the bank keeps promoting me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you want to look at some open houses, I'm happy to waive my fee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Lucy walk into a luxurious apartment. Gourmet kitchen, floor to ceiling windows, giant media center.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So this is at the very top end of what you could probably afford. Are you interested?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hits a button.    A GIANT TELEVISION SCREEN DESCENDS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure? I mean, this is the first place you've looked --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    I've got to run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking forward to meeting Renee tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're all having dinner.    Tonight. Remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.   Of course.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl runs out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl giving blood while on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) I just think if we're going to be rolling out a no interest financing campaign we should commit hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He checks his watch.    The NURSE walks by.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) (covering the phone) Can you unhook me? I have a really important meeting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're interested in donating plasma, feel free to sign up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's listening to a lecture.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Between 1996 and 2000 England's Ministry of Defence paid security cleared experts to research UFOs. This classified study was code named Project Condign.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's phone rings. People look angrily at him.    He sta and PASSES OUT in the aisle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl PULLS UP and RUNS inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His friends are all waiting.    Carl pulls Renee aside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry I'm late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine. It's only the very first time I've met your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was work, it went crazy late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes a breath.    He's about to pass out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's with the "They're Out There" and "I Gave" button?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: REVEAL Carl's sporting buttons that say "They're Out Ther and "I Gave."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long story. (to the hostess) Miss, could I have an orange juice? Like fast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee, Carl, Kath, Seb, Peter and Lucy sit around a table a nice restaurant. As per usual, Carl has several differe meals in front of him. He also has a martini, a glass of water, and a glass of orange juice. Carl's showing off to his friends. As he shows off, Renee looks irritated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (showing off, to Peter) Your wife found me a really great place. Built in Bose surround sound, a 100 inch LCD flat screen TV, roof deck with jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Least I could do. At least he's involved with our wedding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ignoring Lucy's tone) I likey your suit-ey. Hugo Boss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, this old thing?   Prada, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think? We went to three different Prada stores to find the right fit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do yo do for a living, Renee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I paint. I'm in a band. I do volunteer work at a shelter. I teach ESL. I do balloon animal art. You know, a little of this, a little of that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should check out her pottery. It's really big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is big.     How about you guys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Real estate broker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lawyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet beat.   The conversation's not exactly flowing easi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you'll excuse me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter leaves.   The waiter comes over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you made a decision about the wine?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, we're kind of in a celebratory mood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In that case, may I suggest a 97 Petit Rothschild?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Waiter points at a wine that costs $400 a bottle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should wait for Peter to decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know crap about wine. Just pick one, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is sweating bullets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?   Let's celebrate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With six people, I'd recommend two bottles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone's drinking the wine.    Carl's terrified of the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you rent or own?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sublet.    I have this corner of a loft.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a really nice corner though.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you're ever interested in buying, you should ring me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hate owning things. Because when you own something, you suddenly are invested in that thing not breaking. And I break everything. I've gone through three TVS in three years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How did you break them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I smashed one with a hammer, dropped one off my roof and the third one just went on the fritz. So I set it on fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's friends don't really know what to say. The check comes. Carl grabs it before anyone else can. It's a $1500 bill. He drops several credit cards down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's on me! (quietly to the waiter) I'd like to split it between an Advanta Blue Business, Mastercard, a Diners Club and my South Dakota Bank Visa Check card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's outside with Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice job with Renee. She's definitely odd, but that's not necessarily --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just spent $1500 on dinner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because the waiter asked me if I wanted the expensive wine and you weren't there to stop me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't get mad at me about it.   You can just stop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No I can't. If I didn't say yes to the band flier, I never would have met Renee. If I hadn't said yes to taking charge of bank day care and then yes to becoming a loan specialist and then yes to the president's golf trip, I wouldn't be moving up. Each yes leads to the next one. If I stop, it could all fall apart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've gone from a passive guy who always said no to a passive guy who always says yes. Just saying yes is not a legitimate life philosophy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why I should be taking advice from a guy who's wife is pissed he's not involved at all with the wedding planning.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm involved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You told her you don't care whether the invite's cream or ivory.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't see the difference. (opening up) Honestly, I'm terrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's marriage, you know?   The biggest thing ever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you guys have dated for years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're perfect for each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's terrified too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course she is. I think you'll both be a lot less terrified if you're terrified together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But what if I really can't tell the difference between ivory and cream? Does that make me a bad husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What matters is that you pretend you can see the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girls and Seb come out from the restaurant with their coats on. There's a silent beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (high pitched goodbyes) It was wonderful meeting you!/I loved it!/Let me know when you throw your next art thing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone gets into their cars.   Carl and Renee walk off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was great meeting your friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're a little stiff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are a little stiff.   What do you feel like doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm actually going rollerblading with Ralph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ralph?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, crazy rollerblading guitar man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The guy who plays at the promenade?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Any interest?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No. It's ten on a Friday night. And that guy's crazy. Don't you want to go home and make out?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee are making while Carl surreptitiously chec his watch. Finally, Renee stops kissing him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (ANNOYED) Just go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and CRAZY ROLLERBLADING GUITAR MAN rollerblade down street while guitar man plays guitar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which is why the merman is not to be trusted, especially with the fisherman's computer brain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That is really good to know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to come see the merman?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl dashes in, covered in spots of paint.    Chris appea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's playing really intense, terrifying paintball with Norman and Rooney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do this whole Habitat for Humanity Thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love the concept of charity. It's awesome.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A group of KOREAN GENTLEMAN approach Carl and Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS PARKER (cont'd) This is Carl Kendall. This is Jin Kim, Joo-Chan Park, Soo Lee and Seung Kim. Seung's the CEO of Korean Bank International.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Koreans shake Carl's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean, with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [It is an honor to meet you.   Do you like America?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Koreans all start speaking Korean at Carl.   Carl cle doesn't understand what they're saying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris and Carl follow the Koreans.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak Korean?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sneaky devil. I knew I should watch my back around you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is it a problem if I've never played golf before?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a funny one, Carl Kendall. Remember, they have to win. In Asian cultures, there's a concept called Saving Face. You have to let them win. But if they smell for a second that you haven't tried your hardest, they'll commit hari kari.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Metaphorically?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who knows? It's a delicate balance, Kendall. Like two little girls on a see saw with a crocodile beneath them. Make the wrong move, and the little girl will end up in the croc's maw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stands with the Koreans. Seung Kim is speaking very rapidly at Carl. Carl has no idea what he's saying. Seung Kim laughs. Carl laughs along with him. Chris hits a beautiful shot. His ball lands almost on the green. The Koreans notice and nervously chatter. Chris approaches Ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Alright, buddy. It's all you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs a nine iron from the golf bag.    Everyone see very impressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS PARKER (cont'd) You must have quite a powerful stroke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean, to Carl) [Good luck, my friend.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [I shall need the luck.    This is my first time playing.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seung Kim laughs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) (under his breath) Why does everyone think I'm joking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gingerly places the golf ball on the tee.    He look towards the hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) That's really far.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl lines up his shot. He swings back, then forward, and PLOWS the club into the grass, knocking the ball off the The ball rolls down a slight incline resting just a coupl feet from where Carl hit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) (in Korean, to Seung Kim) [You're up, Seung Kim.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks back to where Chris is at.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just keeping them on their toes. Reverse psychology. Tiger Woods does it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seung Kim raises his club back. He too dubs it, driving t club deep into the grass. His ball rolls just a couple fe past Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl hits the ball straight into a group of trees.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Seung Kim, standing right in front of a pond, delicate taps his ball right into the pond.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl keeps divoting the grass. He divots so many times that he has to move the ball out of the hole's he's accidentally dug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Seung Kim hits his ball out of the sand trap. It rolls back in. He tries again. It rolls back in. He's about to try again when Carl picks up his ball and tosses it over lip of the sand trap. Carl holds his finger up to his lip "Shhh."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Carl's about to hit the ball when his phone rings.   H answers it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Of course not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The other golfers look really impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Male.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I prefer light beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three to five times a week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Orlando.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl holds up his finger.   Only one moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- It's   getting late. Now both Carl and Seung Kim are hitting   their balls at once to save time. They are both running   and hacking at their balls across the fairway a they're   playing a deranged game of field hockey.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl is counting up the scores.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris, you hit a 90.   Nice one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I bogied the fifth hole.   I'm still pissed about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Joo-Chan hit a 95. Nice work.      As for Seung Kim. You hit 453.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seung glowers at Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) And as for me, I hit... (doing some computations) ... 503.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seung Kim pumps his fist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to say that team Korean Bank International has won.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seung Kim slaps five with his compatriots.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, Chris and the Koreans are all hanging out. Carl is alone in the corner of the conference hall. A PRETTY FEMA KOREAN BANKER approaches Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [You are quite the golfer.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [I golf from crotch noodle.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.   She laughs.   He laughs along with her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [I have a business proposition for you. My marriage is not a happy one. I often find my needs are left unsatisfied.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [I agree. The weather is sunny.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [I wish that was so.] (in English) Kiss me? Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl doesn't know what to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She kisses him passionately.    Carl breaks away from the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Am I not sexy? Have you not heard of saving face?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're very sexy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and the Korean Banker kiss more.   Carl looks guilty

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's shaking hands with the Korean Bank Representatives Chris shakes Carl's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm promoting you to bank manager. (pulling Carl close) I've got my eye on you, boy. Don't you forget it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris laughs. Carl nervously laughs along with him. The Pretty Korean Banker walks by and waves at him. Carl wave back. He looks very guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into the pottery studio, looking guilty.   Ren making a giant piece of pottery.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's up, chicken butt? (off his guilty look)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) Are you OK? Did everything go OK at golf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl considers whether he should say anything about the k

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just got promoted to bank manager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Congratulations!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee kisses Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) Oooh, we should do some sexy pottery. Like you can rub the clay all over me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl goes to grab some clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was kidding. Not as sexy as it seems. It gets in like everywhere. (awkward beat) What should we do to celebrate?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about Korean? Oh, no, you probably already had some today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (NERVOUSLY) No, we just had American food, American fare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've just been so busy -- it'd be fun to have a night just the two of us. I wish we could just go to the airport and hop on the first flight outta here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's eyes light up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee and Carl are in line at the ticketing counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with an English accent) I think we're going to London.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a Spanish accent) Oaxaca, senorita.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with a Russian accent) Moscow, Russia, comrade.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with an unidentifiable

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Singapore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My Singaporean accent.     Pretty good, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get to the front of the line.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) (PROUDLY) We want two tickets on the next plane out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two tickets to... Lincoln, Nebraska.   Have a good time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee take the tickets.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (acting positive) Lincoln, Nebraska! Here we come, baby!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That'll be twelve hundred and thirty three dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we shouldn't do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been promoted.     I've got money to burn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl nervously hands the Airline Rep his credit card.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's walking towards security when he runs into TONY, t homosexual guy he hooked up with. Tony's handing out his books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you want to change your life through Mahayana Buddhism?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes one of the books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TONY (cont'd) Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl realizes who he is. Suddenly they are in the middle an awkward ex-lover interaction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How've you been?     You... never called.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.     I've been busy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well, I've been busy too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee comes up and grabs Carl's arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, who's your friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tony looks at Renee and realizes that she's Carl's girlfriend.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) I'm Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Tony. I'm an old, close friend of Carl's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flight 2036 to Lincoln, Nebraska, now boarding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's our flight. We should probably get going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See you soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dripping with bitterness) Have fun. You abigail.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee head off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee and Carl have the aisle and window on the plane. YOUNG WOMAN comes up to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, there. Would you mind switching places with me? I want to be across the aisle from my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her MOM is indeed across from Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're actually flying together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It would really mean a great deal. She's very scared of flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's your seat?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The YOUNG WOMAN points at her seat. It's a couple rows up the middle. Her middle seat's BOOKENDED by a MOM with a SCREAMING BABY and an ENORMOUS MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) This is an aisle. That's a middle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee looks at Carl like, why won't you just refuse?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really scared of flying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl between the crying baby and the ENORMOUS MAN. Renee turns and waves to him from a couple rows up. Carl puts o saccharin smile and waves back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee are in the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, now that we're here, what should we do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, clearly we should go there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl points to an advertisement for a telephone museum: "Come to the Frank H. Woods Telephone Pioneer Museum."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee are looking at MANNEQUINS OF NINETEENTH CENTURY SWITCHBOARD OPERATORS. It's incredibly quiet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had no idea that the earliest switchboard operator headsets weighed ten and a half pounds. That is fascinating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee laughs. An ELDERLY TOUR GUIDE dressed as a telephon operator approaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in character) I'll connect you to the coast in an instant with Alexander Graham Bell's brand new invention -- the telephone! Just a haypenny per ten minutes. (out of character)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ELDERLY TOUR GUIDE (cont'd) This place is boring as shit. Check out the Lester F. Larsen Tractor Test & Power Museum. Now that's an attraction. Ask for Billy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hands Carl a brochure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee stand outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have to do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're here. We might as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee RIDE A TRACTOR.   Renee's taking photos as BUMP OVER THE FIELD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THIS IS AWESOME!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: WANT ME TO OPEN THIS SUCKER UP?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: YES!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The driver TURNS UP THE SPEED.   They're suddenly going c fast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TAKE THE WHEEL! FEEL THE POWER OF JOHN DEERE!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes the wheel. The tractor IMMEDIATELY GETS AWAY F HIM. They SWERVE STRAIGHT and CRASH THROUGH THE WALL OF A OLD BARN. The DRIVER kills the engine. Renee, Carl and th Driver catch their breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's, uhh, no power steering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a tractor, not a Toyota.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry about the barn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been meaning to tear this sucker down anyway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee walk around a surprisingly pretty city par

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I might have whiplash from that tractor ride.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just don't sue me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch your back, Carl.   I mean it. I'm very litigious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This day has been so randomly incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you... want to... travel around the world with me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean, I know we haven't really been seeing each other for that long, but I don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Definitely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I'm falling, you know... Are you... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Before our flight, what do you say we grab a couple Nebraskan steaks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm definitely falling for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's sitting in the lounge at the Lincoln Airport.    A WOMAN comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me. Would you mind bringing this to my son?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Woman hands Carl an UNMARKED, SHADY-LOOKING PACKA

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like you want me to bring it with me? On the plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fedex is so expensive and this needs to get to him today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (very nervous) Yeah. Sure. I'd be happy to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a tall, blond fellow named Sheldon Winkleton. He'll be holding a sign in the terminal with his name on it. You are a dear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Woman shuffles off.    Carl looks at the box.   R returns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I got US Weekly, Star and, for a little culture, the National Enquirer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: National Enquirer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They have movie reviews.    What's in the package?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just a gift for some buddies back home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks through security. He puts the package on the conveyor belt. They don't notice anything odd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee sit next to each other on the plane.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I have to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee heads to the bathroom. Carl takes the package out f under the seat in front of him. He starts to breathe real hard. He very gingerly opens the package. He pulls back t packing peanuts revealing... a box of homemade chocolates Carl breathes a SIGH OF RELIEF.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee walk off the plane, Carl carrying the pack under his arm. Carl sees a tall blond guy holding a sign that says "SHELDON WINKLETON." He heads towards the guy b before he can several DEA AGENTS with ADORABLE, DRUG SNIF DOGS surround Carl. The dogs start BARKING LIKE MAD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the package down!    Put it down!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks up to see "Sheldon" WALKING SWIFTLY OUT THE SLIDING DOORS of the airport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DEA AGENT (cont'd) Get on the ground! Both of you!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DEA AGENTS KICK the box open. Chocolates spill out ov the ground. They crack open the chocolates to reveal TINY BAGGIES OF COCAINE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell is that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Carl is dragged out by the cops, he passes Tony, stand near the exit, shaking his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's sitting across from two DEA Agents, Good Cop Bob a Bad Cop Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I'm Bob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl can't help but laugh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BAD COP BOB (cont'd) Do you find that funny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sees his hand with "Yes" on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. I'm sorry. Just let the girl go. She doesn't know anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll see about that, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some old lady gave me a package in the Lincoln airport to deliver to her son, Sheldon Winkleton. That was really stupid of me and I realize that now. I don't know anything about anything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just answer a few questions and I'm sure we'll get this all sorted out. Have you ever used illegal drugs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stares at them.    He should probably lie...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pot?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.   But that's all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How about shrooms?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But that's the only bad shit I've done. I swear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never cheated on a girlfriend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, I have. But I was in high school. I was a mess. She had cheated on me --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Bad Cop SLAMS his fist down on the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You disgust me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Good Cop restrains the Bad Cop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two cops DISCUSS Carl. We see Carl freaking out throu the one-way mirror behind them as they talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a moron. But I think he's telling the truth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I agree. No one ever admits to the cheating question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's sitting on the steps.    Renee comes out of the st

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can explain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So explain. Are you a drug smuggler?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, when the nice lady asked me to take them on the plane, I thought they were chocolates.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You expect me to believe a nice lady asked you to bring chocolates on a plane?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know how it sounds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl just looks at her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RENEE (cont'd) If you can't be honest with me, then you and the nice lady can have a fun life in Candyland.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee starts off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait!     I'll explain better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits across from Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you've just been saying yes to everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. (THEN) Pardon the pun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: See? Do you get it now? It's nothing, just a glitch really.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought we had so much in common but if you just yes to everything I don't know that we do. How do I know if you even like Korean food?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you even want to travel around the world at all or do you want to work at that bank and buy a lot of Prada suits?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONFUSED) Yes. And yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something registers in Renee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When I asked if you were falling for me all you said was yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She rises, shaking her head, and heads for the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It wasn't a lie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.    It was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's strapped to a giant plasma donation machine. It's horrifying. As he donates plasma, he could not look more depressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It'll be over soon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't care. Just take it all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl stumbles into the lounge outside Chris's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris will be with you in a moment. Would you like something to drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into Chris's office carrying a cup of coffee a Diet Coke, and a bottle of water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So I got a call from the police department.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not a drug dealer --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris closes the door to his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I spent a couple years in prison myself. So I backdated some stock options. Excuse me for trying to help our bottom line, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got to do what you got to do to help Mr. And Mrs. Shareholder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We are their slaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Totally.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honestly, I prefer for all my top guys to have been in the Big House. We've all eaten the slop. There's a trust there you can't break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS PARKER (cont'd) So, what do you say to being a VP and expanding your microloan program bankwide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl shakes Chris's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's office has VIEWS of other corporate parks. Despite the fancy digs, Carl's depressed. Chris pokes his head in Carl's on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (on the phone) That's right, we're dropping the minimum loan to one dollar, bank- wide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you look through these numbers and let me know which of our five branches have been lagging behind in profit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris dumps a folder on Carl's desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I was just implementing the microloan program.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a VP, buddy. You do it all now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's taking a pottery lesson. He is sadly going through the motions of making a pot. He checks his watch and departs, leaving the unfinished pot spinning on the potte wheel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The VPs are sitting around the board room.    Carl comes late, still covered in clay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry about that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, I'm glad you could join us. So, to keep you all updated, we should be merging with Korean Bank International within the year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone claps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS PARKER (cont'd) As per our argument with KBI, we'll be shoring up our bottom line. Carl Kendall's done us the honor of drawing up a preliminary list of the branches that are on the chopping block. Nice work, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl looks horrified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's in the middle of a heated discussion with Chris.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't close the Maple Branch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know that Maple's where you got your start, but if I don't lay those people off then I get laid off. It's a vicious cycle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have to if you don't want to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (deadly serious) If we don't close these branches than KBI will buy our competitor instead of us and put us all out of business. If you want to be an executive and get to do fun stuff like your microloan project, then you also have to be the bad guy who lays people off. That's why we get paid the big bucks. To make the hard decisions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Norman's crying.   Rooney's getting worked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bank's all I've got. Every morning I restock the hard candy, polish the safe, write today's interest rates on the board.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other banks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We have to protest the merger.   Get some grassroots action going. Grass looks weak, but it grows everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't even work at the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You should protest with us!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah! Protest with your employees! It will only make you more popular!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Southwest Bank employees and Carl stand in a picket line outside the corporate offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell no! We won't go!    Hell no! We won't go!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris gets out of his car and heads to the office. Carl hides his face from Chris so that Chris won't recognize h

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Throw a rock at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, throw a rock!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl grabs a rock and VERY DELICATELY LOBS IT in Chris's direction. He then TAKES OFF RUNNING in the opposite direction. He then CIRCLES AROUND and runs into the back entrance of the bank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We FOLLOW Carl as he runs up the service entrance to the corporate offices.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl then RUNS into his office and sits down at the desk. He's covered in sweat and is breathing heavily. Chris pok his head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some asshole protestor threw a rock at my head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those dicks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I wish using hoses wasn't such bad PR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris leaves his office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits across from Peter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think I made a mistake letting Renee go like that. What if I'm supposed to go on that trip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You own an apartment because of that job. People don't generally leave good jobs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But the bank doesn't feel right...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter's phone rings.   Peter picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, honey. I think we should go with the tulips. I know roses are more romantic, but they're also much more clichГ©d. Babe, can you wait a second? (covering the phone) I'm going to be on for a while. Ask your guru. He's the one who sent you on this retarded quest in the first place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanji's SIGNING BOOKS.    Carl gets to the front of the l

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Sanji.     I'm Carl.   Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (no memory of Carl) Of course! Would you like to purchase my new book, "The Power of Yes: Life is Yessy"?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I had a question for you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this line is for book customers only.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sanji's eating by himself.    Carl comes up to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry to bother you again --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't you see that I'm eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a really important question. I have to choose between traveling around the world with a girl I'm really into or choosing a job that will make me pretty well off. I don't know which yes to take.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How well off?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know why that's important.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I should know all the data.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lot, OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is    what I recommend. Every winter,    I throw a two week long seminar    in Aspen. It's only ten grand a    week and it will open your mind up    --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go to a seminar. I just need help with this question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you, eight grand a week. I have helped celebrities like Cher and Jack Welch. You will love it --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (REALIZING) You're a total con artist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am not a con artist. Have I not set you on the life path you desire?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (PANICKING) I've put my life into the hands of a con artist! And because of you I have this retarded yes branded on my hand for life! (yelling to the

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This man is a con artist! Don't listen to this man! He is a con artist!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl runs out of the restaurant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl returns home.    Rooney's on the couch, wearing a he playing Xbox Live.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into the headset) You are dead, AnalDestroyer832!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl PULLS the xBox cord out of the law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Out!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?   Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've slept on my couch for four weeks. You're a grown man. Now sack up and get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will you let me stay here please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you deaf?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to say yes if I ask you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I may not seem like I get it, but I get everything. Lucy and Kath? Made out one time in the bathroom at Rudy's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get the hell out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's in front of his computer. There are a bunch of ema selling Viagra. He angrily deletes them all. He gets a letter from the King of Nigeria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Carl, It is vitally important you send me your bank account information. The government will be closing in on my account in the very near future. Your good friend, Omar, Former King of Nigeria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl starts typing fast. As Carl writes the following ema we cuts of him THROWING AWAY THE BOXES OF STUFF HE BOUGHT OVER THE INTERNET and GIVING AWAY THE SIX KITTENS HE GOT THE ASPCA.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar, Let's cut the crap. You are not a king. You're probably just a teenage con artist jerking off somewhere in Russia. Write me again and I will find you and beat your stupid lying face in. Dick. Sincerely, Carl Kendall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl angrily flips off his computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON THE ALARM.   His alarm goes off.   Carl HITS IT It's now DAYTIME.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gets dressed. He puts on his suit and tie. His apartment is noticeably nicer than the last time we saw i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl drives down the street in a FANCY CAR. He PULLS INTO DUNKIN DONUTS. He gets out of the car and passes a guy handing out fliers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to pawn --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into Dunkin Donuts.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Dunkin Donuts Cashier hands Carl his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you like an --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hands the Cashier the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl sits in his office.   Lucy walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Luce. What're you doing all the way over here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been hard to reach you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been a little swamped.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everything OK?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.   Things are great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was wondering when you want to meet with the florist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry, but I'm too busy these days. Don't have time to help with the party anymore. Good luck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just stopping, just like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not the one marrying you. Maybe you should ask him for some help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He is helping. Here I was thinking we were actual friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy leaves, upset.   Carl doesn't move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, Chris and the other VPs sit around the conference table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (with great importance) What is the best way for us to enter the teenage credit card market?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give away a free iPod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Include one with cans of Mountain Dew Code Red.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice.   Anyone else? Carl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you guys thought that teenagers don't have the financial knowhow to use a credit card?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's why they're such a ripe market. Any ideas on how to pick that low hanging fruit?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Include a Mastercard with every xBox.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like that. I like that a lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris SLAPS FIVE with Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS PARKER (cont'd) Now remember, tomorrow's our official merger ceremony with KBI. So wear your nice suits. I'm talking to you, Feldman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the VPs laugh.   Carl fake laughs along with them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gets home.   He hits play on his answering machine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the answering

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, Carl. Peter here. Long time no see. Sorry to hear you won't be planning our engagement party. Although I guess that makes you less gay than I thought you were. We'll be watching the game at Rudy's tonight, if you're interested.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl DELETES the message. He FLIPS ON Survivor and starts absentmindedly sort through his mail. He throws away junkmail until he gets to a postcard that catches his eye He reads the postcard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dear Carl. I know this is kind of random, but I thought I should write you. We met at that party at Norman's apartment. I was the INS guy who hated his life and hated you. I just wanted to tell you that I took your advice. I quit my job and have founded a home in Botswana for elderly orangutans. I've never been happier. You told me to say "yes" and it has turned out to be incredible. Thank you. Yours truly, Jason Newmark

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl TURNS OVER the post card.   On the cover of the card picture an orangutan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's alarm goes off. He opens his eyes. He's PROPPED th post card up next to his alarm clock. The orangutan seems be staring into his soul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's writing a list of names. The post card lies on the desk nearby. His secretary pops her head in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The executives are gathering in the conference room to officially greet the KBI Officials.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL'S SECRETARY (cont'd) (re: the post card) Cute gorilla.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's an elderly orangutan actually. (handing her the list) Could you please call everyone on this list and tell them to show up at Rudy's Bar & Grille this evening at 9PM?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Will do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl starts to head out and then turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to say, it was really great having you as my first secretary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not firing me, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I'm going to be working here much longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl walks into the crowded room.   Korean executives and Southwest Bank executives mingle.   Carl heads towards Ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need to talk to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I need to talk to you. You mind doing a little ceremonial translating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I'm good enough at Korean --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Believe in yourself and the world believes in you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SEUNG sees Carl and bows to him. Carl bows back. The Pret Korean Banker sees Carl and coquettishly waves to him. Chris TAPS the microphone. The crowd sits down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHRIS PARKER (cont'd) I'd like to welcome our new partners into the Southwest family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris nods to Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean, with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [Welcome. You will be my partner.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [Thank you.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KBI is the at the forefront of the financial world. With your help, Southwest will be as well.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl takes a beat.    Chris looks at him, expectantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean, with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [He says that you are a son of a dog and like to have the dirty sex.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [What?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We look forward to working together and extending our reach across the globe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean, with

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: [He says in Korea you poop on the ground and that here you cannot poop on the ground.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [That is factually inaccurate]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [I know. But it's what the bigot believes.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So with this hand shake, I make official the acquisition of Southwest by Korean Bank International.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chris holds out his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Korean) [Although you have poop on your hand, I am willing to shake it so I can steal all your money, you stupid Korean.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (perfect English with a British accent) We have a traitor in our midst. This man just called me a son of a dog and informed me that my hand is covered in fecal matter. He is clearly trying to sabotage the merger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You speak English?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think an international bank financier wouldn't speak fluent English? For whom do you work, traitor? Shanghai Bank? Chinatrust?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Keep it secret. Unfortunately, I cannot approve a merger with a company so incompetent as to have a business saboteur this high up. Good day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seung Kim walks out, followed by all his employees.   Bef Chris can say anything...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Peter, Lucy, Rooney, Norman, Tony, Loan Recipients, sever Persian Woman -- all of Carl's friends along with everyon that he's met on his Yes journey have gathered at Rudy's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why does he want us here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have no idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kath and Seb walk in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Lucy) You guys get the call as well?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN OVER to Rooney standing alone.    Farinoush, the Pers woman, walks over to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Farinoush.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Rooney.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're tall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just then the lights go down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: Rocky Theme.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (over the loudspeakers) Announcing the pending marriage of Peter Carlton and Lucy Giuliano!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl RIDES INTO THE BAR on a WHITE STALLION as WHITE BALL FALL FROM THE RAFTERS. Carl JUMPS OFF the horse, and puts CROWN on Peter's and a TIARA on Lucy's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CARL (cont'd) Congratulations on your engagement!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wow.    There's a horse in here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are all these people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't have much time to throw this together. I got a stallion, didn't I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks, Carl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: The Black-Eyed Peas "My Humps"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucy KISSES Carl on the cheek.    Everyone starts dancing

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's standing outside. Peter comes outside.      He's d and is still wearing the crown.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing out here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl hands Peter a set of keys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I entrust you to sell all my shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cab PULLS UP.   Peter realizes Carl's leaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETER (cont'd) Say hello to her when you see her. Where is she by the way?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl's in a tuk tuk being driven at breakneck speed down windy streets of Bangkok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MUSIC CUE: ABBA's "One Night in Bangkok"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl gets up to the roof. Renee's looking out over Bangko He taps her on the shoulder. She turns.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What're you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't ask you a question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, if you do that's what my answer will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you here because you want to be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just flew twenty-two hours. What do you think? Now can I please kiss you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Renee nods.   They kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl has set up a makeshift loan office.   He's sitting a from a YOUNG THAI MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Thai, with subtitles) [I need ten thousand bhat to get my first tuk tuk. If I get a tuk tuk I no longer have to mop the ping pong show floor and clean the snake.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Thai, with subtitles) [What snake?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Thai, with subtitles) [You don't want to know.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PULL BACK TO REVEAL that Norman sits at the table next to Carl working with an OLD THAI MAN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Thai, with subtitles) [You guys don't have Heroes? I don't know you, but I think you would love it.]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in Thai, with subtitles) [If I like it will you give me money to fix my fishing boat?]

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CHYRON: Makurdi, Nigeria

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Renee get out a dusty minivan. A dirty, rundown palace rises before them. Carl HEADS to the front door an hits the BUZZER. A guard with a MACHINE GUN opens up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here to see Omar.   The former King of Nigeria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OMAR, THE FORMER KING OF NIGERIA, a large, boisterous man comes up from behind the guard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that Carl Kendall?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar! It's wonderful to meet you in person

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl and Omar hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And this must be Renee? What a delight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Omar bends on one knee and kisses Renee on the hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you, your majesty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please, call me Omar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry for calling you a masturbatory Russian teenager.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Water under the bridge. What do you say to having a feast?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carl, Omar, Renee and the guard go into Omar's palace. Th door CLOSES BEHIND THEM.
